subject.name: Discrete Mathematics
subject.description: Introduces the fundamental concepts of discrete mathematics used in computer science, focusing on logic, proofs, sets, relations, functions, algebraic structures, and graph theory. Emphasizes mathematical reasoning, formal proofs, and problem-solving techniques essential for algorithmic and theoretical computing foundations.
objectives: Use mathematically correct terminology and notation
Construct correct direct and indirect proofs
Use division into cases and counterexamples in proofs
Apply logical reasoning to solve a variety of problems

units.title: Sets, Relations and Functions
topics: Binary Relation and Partial Ordering Relation
Size of a Set: Finite and Infinite Sets
Cantor’s Diagonal Argument and The Power Set Theorem

units.title: Mathematical Induction and Counting
topics: Division Algorithm: Prime Numbers, Greatest Common Divisor, Euclidean Algorithm, Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
Counting Techniques: Inclusion–Exclusion Principle, Pigeonhole Principle, Permutation and Combination

units.title: Propositional and Predicate Logic
topics: Logical Equivalence: Laws of Logic, Logical Implication, Rules of Inference, Use of Quantifiers
Proof Techniques: Forward Proof, Proof by Contradiction, Contrapositive, and Necessity–Sufficiency Proofs

units.title: Algebraic Structures and Boolean Algebra
topics: Algebraic Structures with One Binary Operation: Semigroups, Monoids, Groups
Congruence Relations, Quotient Structures, Free and Cyclic Groups, Permutation Groups
Algebraic Structures with Two Binary Operations: Rings, Integral Domains, and Fields
Identities of Boolean Algebra, Duality, Representation of Boolean Functions

units.title: Graphs and Trees
topics: Graphs and Properties: Degree, Connectivity, Path, Cycle, Subgraph, Isomorphism
Bi-connected Components, Articulation Points, and Shortest Paths

suggested_books: Kenneth H. Rosen, Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications, Tata McGraw-Hill
Susanna S. Epp, Discrete Mathematics with Applications, 4th Edition, Wadsworth Publishing Co. Inc.
C. L. Liu and D. P. Mohapatra, Elements of Discrete Mathematics: A Computer Oriented Approach, 3rd Edition, Tata McGraw-Hill
